summary.para: The Microsoft AdControl provides everything that is necessary to display advertising in an app.
Instantiates an AdControl and provides the optional targeting parameters.

remarks.para: The AdControl is configured to show a new ad every 60 seconds. This is the default setting. If this behavior does not suit the app, you can set IsAutoRefreshEnabled to false and use the Refresh method to request that the AdControl show the next ad that is available.
Do not use the same instance of an AdControl across multiple pages.
Once set, the parent of the AdControl should not be changed.
All of the required properties on the AdControl need to be set before adding the control to a parent object. These required properties include AdUnitId and ApplicationId.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new AdControl.

remarks.para: The developer must set the ApplicationId and AdUnitId properties before the app can show an ad.
The default value for the size of the AdControl is 480x80 pixels.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize a new AdControl with the provided parameters.
member.remarks: A constructor for an AdControl that takes the properties ApplicationId, AdUnitId, and IsAutoRefreshEnabled as parameters."
member.param: The application ID of the app. This value is provided when the app is registered with pubCenter.
The ad unit identifier for this AdControl instance. This value is provided to the publisher when the publisher creates an AdUnit in pubCenter. See the Publisher Onboarding Guide for more information.
Enables or disables the automatic refresh of ads.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.Refresh

summary.para: A call to this method directs the AdControl to show the next ad as soon as an ad becomes available.
This method may not be used when IsAutoRefreshEnabled is set to true.

member.remarks: A new ad might not be available because of an error that occurred while trying to contact the ad platform.
member.exception: The IsAutoRefreshEnabled property is set to true.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.Suspend
member.summary: Suspends the current ad and replaces the current view of the ad with a snapshot of what was currently being rendered. If the ad was engaged, this action is cancelled and the expanded ad is closed. After calling Suspend the AdControl will not automatically refresh, even if IsAutoRefreshEnabled=true, and you cannot manually refresh the AdControl until Resume has been called.
member.remarks: When the ad is suspended, user cannot interact with the ad until Resume has been called.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.Suspend(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Suspends the current ad and replaces the current view of the ad with a snapshot of what was currently being rendered. If the ad was engaged, this action is cancelled and the expanded ad is closed. After calling Suspend the AdControl will not automatically refresh, if IsAutoRefreshEnabled=true, and you cannot manually refresh the AdControl until Resume has been called.
member.remarks: When the ad is suspended, user cannot interact with the ad until Resume has been called.
member.param: If true and the ad was engaged, this action is cancelled and the expanded ad is closed. If false then no action is taken on the expanded ad.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.Resume
member.summary: Removes the static snapshot of the AdControl and replaces it with the dynamic display. Resumes automatic refresh of the AdControl, if IsAutoRefreshEnable=true, and allows manual refresh to occur again.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.AddAdTag(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add an ad tag to the AdControl. The maximum is 10 tags per AdControl. If the maximum number of tags is exceeded an errorOccurred event will be fired.
member.param: The name of the ad tag. Maximum of 16 characters. If the maximum number of characters is exceeded an errorOccurred event will be fired.
The value of the ad tag. Maximum of 128 characters. If the maximum number of characters is exceeded an errorOccurred event will be fired.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.RemoveAdTag(System.String)
member.summary: Remove an ad tag from the AdControl. This has no effect if the tag name does not exist.
member.param: The name of the ad tag to remove.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.SendMessageToAd(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Pass data to the current AdControl renderer that was received from another AdControl instance through the PublisherMessageEvent delegate. Used to synchronize the display of ads among multiple AdControl objects
member.param: The type of the message received from another AdControl.
The data of the message received from another AdControl.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.ErrorOccurred
member.summary: Error event that is raised when the AdControl encounters an error while retrieving ads.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.AdRefreshed
member.summary: Event that is raised when the AdControl receives a new ad.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.IsEngagedChanged
member.summary: Event that is raised when the user clicks on the ad and the action dialog is waiting for input from the user.
member.remarks: This event is intended to give developers the option to pause the app when the action dialog appears.

member.name: E:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.PublisherMessageEvent
member.summary: Event that is raised when the user moves to the media of the ad. The metadata of the media being displayed by the ad is passed as part of the event.
member.remarks: Use this event to send data to another AdControl instance in order to synchronize the display of ads.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.Keywords
member.summary: Gets or sets the keywords as a comma-separated list. Keywords allow the app to provide ads that are relevant to the user.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.Latitude
member.summary: The latitude of the user. The location is in the format of a latitude coordinate.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.Longitude
member.summary: The longitude of the user. The location is in the format of a longitude coordinate.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.CountryOrRegion
member.summary: A 2-character country or region code of the user of the app. This value is used by all of the ads in the app.
member.remarks: The country or region codes are specified by the ISO 3166-1 standard. This standard is available at http://www.iso.org/iso/country_codes/iso_3166_code_lists/english_country_names_and_code_elements.htm.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.PostalCode
member.summary: The postal code of the user of the app.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.AutoRefreshIntervalInSeconds
member.summary: Set the auto-refresh interval in seconds.

remarks.para: Value should be equal to or larger than default auto-refresh value.
If value is set less than the default auto-refresh value, the default auto-refresh value will be used.

summary.para: Gets or sets the ad unit identifier for this AdControl instance.
This value is provided to the publisher when the publisher creates an AdUnit in pubCenter. See the Publisher Onboarding Guide for more information.

remarks.para: This property can only be set when the AdControl is instantiated by using the default constructor.
Once set, this property cannot be modified.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.ApplicationId
member.summary: The application ID of the app. This value is provided to you when you register the app with pubCenter.

remarks.para: Only one value for the application ID can be used within an app.
If more than one value for the ApplicationId is used in different AdControl objects that are in the app, some controls will not receive ads and will raise an ErrorOccurred event.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.IsAutoRefreshEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables the automatic refresh of ads. This property cannot be changed after the AdControl is added to a page.
member.remarks: This property can only be set when the AdControl is instantiated by using the default constructor or in XAML. Once set, this property cannot be modified later. This property is set to true by default.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.IsAutoCollapseEnabled
member.summary: Enables or disables the automatic hiding of the AdControl if no ad is available or an error occurs.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.IsEngaged
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the user is currently interacting with one of the ads.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.IsSuspended
member.summary: Gets the current suspended state of the AdControl.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.HasAd
member.summary: Gets the current ad state.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Advertising.Mobile.UI.AdControl.IsBackgroundTransparent
member.summary: When this property is set to true the background of the ad control is transparent. When this property is set to false the background is black. Default value is black.
